title: 2011 A1286 repeating hard Drive Failure
message: I have a 2011 A1286 that is back for the 3rd time due to hard drive failure. Partition is unrecoverable. I have tried EasUS and Disk Drill so far. My question is, is it possible for a board or cable to be causing this recurring problem? I have replaced the drive 3 times like i said. Thanks for any help in advance.

title: 2011 A1286 repeating hard Drive Failure
message: It could be a bad HDD cable...

title: 2011 A1286 repeating hard Drive Failure
message: There is a difference between a HDD failure and just a corrupt file system, which is it?

title: 2011 A1286 repeating hard Drive Failure
message:
cable failure could be easily diagnosed with SMART. check for CRC errors, this counter shows controller <--> HDD data line errors. if smart is ok, next step is to change it to SSD. it could be simply the customer's behavior - i hade one with a habit of tapping rhythms on the palmrest. :rolleyes:
also, for HFS+ repair I strictly recommend you Disk Warrior, this utility works literally like a charm when diskutil fails.

message:

title: 2011 A1286 repeating hard Drive Failure
message: Bad sectors are not caused by the machine. You either have bad luck or you are getting crap drives from someone or this guy is knocking this thing around. Swap a SSD in there and then in 3 months he will be back with a dead GPU.
